summary: "Casino Royale" (2006) is the 21st James Bond movie and the third adaptation of Ian Fleming's novel. Directed by Martin Campbell, it introduces Daniel Craig as a younger, more vulnerable Bond. Bond's mission is to bankrupt terrorist financier Le Chiffre in a poker game at Montenegro's Casino Royale. The film was critically acclaimed and earned over $616 million, setting a record for the highest-grossing Bond film at the time. It led to a sequel, "Quantum of Solace," in 2008.
title: Casino Royale (2006 film)
